'''Snover''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese:]] '''ユキカブリ''' ''Yukikaburi'') is a dual-type {{2t|Grass|Ice}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation IV]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s into {{p|Abomasnow}} starting at [[level]] 40.

==Biology==
[[File:Snoverberry.png|left|240px|thumb|Male Snover growing Snoverberries in the anime]]
Snover is a creature with a white upper body and brown lower body that resembles a snow-covered tree. It will be two-thirds brown if male and two-thirds white if female. It has green eyes and three points on top of its head. Its feet and green tail are stubby, and there are two green spikes that resemble pinecones on its back. Five cones form its hand: a large central cone with four smaller cones around it. Edible white berries grow along Snover's midsection. Snover lives on snowy peaks in warm seasons, but migrates lower as the weather cools. A curious Pokémon, it often approaches people and can be found inspecting footprints in the snow.

==In the anime==
[[File:Snover anime.png|thumb|left|250px|Male Snover in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Snover debuted in [[PK18]]. [[Dawn's Piplup]] and [[Ash's Aipom]] bumped into one while wandering around in a cave, and it subsequently went on a rampage.

A {{pkmn2|talking}} Snover appeared in [[PK19]].

A male Snover appeared in ''[[DP121|The Lonely Snover]]'', where it wanted to be friends with {{Ash}} and {{ashfr}}.

A female Snover was used by [[Candice]] to battle {{Ash}} in ''[[DP127|Sliding Into Seventh!]]''. It battled {{AP|Gliscor}} and managed to defeat it before being beaten by {{AP|Chimchar}}.

A male Snover appeared in ''[[XY083|Over the Mountain of Snow!]]''. It wasn't feeling well and was being looked after by an {{p|Abomasnow}}. With help from {{an|Clemont}}, Snover soon recovered.
[[File:Candice Snover.png|Female Snover in the anime|250px|thumb|left]]

===Minor appearances===
A Snover appeared in ''[[M11|Giratina and the Sky Warrior]]'' as one of the many Pokémon attempting to stop a glacier from destroying the [[Ten'i Village|nearby village]].

A male Snover appeared in ''[[DP141|Challenging a Towering Figure!]]'', where it battled against a {{p|Donphan}} during the {{DL|Twinleaf Festival|Festival Battle Challenge}}.

A Snover appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M13|Zoroark: Master of Illusions]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Nurse Joy PDP.png|thumb|120px|left|Snover in [[Pocket Monsters Diamond & Pearl]]]]
[[File:Candice Snover Adventures.png|thumb|100px|Snover in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pocket Monsters Diamond & Pearl manga===
In the {{OBP|Pocket Monsters Diamond & Pearl|Sakai Takayuki}} manga, {{Ash}} and [[Nurse Joy]] rescue an injured Snover in ''[[PDP04|Hurry Up! Dawn's Pinch!!]]''.

===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
[[Candice]] has a collection of ice Pokémon in her Gym that includes multiple Snover, but the only one she uses in battle is the one that fought [[Platinum's Empoleon]], which also happens to be the only one she caught. She was seemingly defeated by the Emperor Pokémon's {{m|Metal Claw}}, but managed to launch a {{m|Seed Bomb}} that landed on Empoleon's head, fainting her and resulting in a tie. It first appeared in ''[[PS387|Striking Out Snover]]''.

==Other appearances==
===[[Super Smash Bros. Brawl]]===
In the {{St|Pokémon Stadium 2}} stage, a Snover can be seen on the {{t|Ice}} terrain.

====Trophy information====
''"A Frost Tree Pokémon. It lives in snowy mountains and resembles a wintry peak. In the spring it grows berries that resemble ice candies. In battle it causes a storm to appear, hides itself in fog, and then creates and launches a ball of ice as a preemptive strike. It evolves into Abomasnow."''

==Trivia==
* Snover is the only Pokémon with a base stat total of 334.
* No other Pokémon share the same type combination as Snover and its evolution {{p|Abomasnow}}.

===Origin===
Snover appears to have been made to resemble a snow-covered {{wp|fir|fir tree}}. Its 'hat' resembles the kanji for mountain (山) which originates from a pictogram of three mountain peaks.

===Name origin===
Snover may be a combination of ''snow'' and ''clover'' or ''cover'' (as in covered with snow). Alternatively, it may be a shortening of the phrase "snowed over".

Yukikaburi is a combination of 雪 ''yuki'' (snow) and 頭 ''kaburi'' (head). Alternatively, it may also derive from 蕪菁 ''kabu'' ({{wp|turnip}}) or 被せる ''kabuseru'' (to cover).
